p: Î²-Carotene (1,3,3-trimethyl-2-[(1 E,3 E,5 E,7 E, E,11 E,13 E,1 E,17 E)-3,7,12,16-tetramethyl-18-(2,6,6-trimethylcyclohexen-1-yl) octadeca-1,3,5,7,9,11,13,15,17-nonaenyl] cyclohexene) ( Figure 2) is a tetraterpene carotenoid, an organic pigment synthesized universally by all photoautotrophs, including macroalgae and plants [ 45]. It is often found in the human diet metabolically converted to vitamin A [ 46]. It is widely known for its relevant physiological function as an effective antioxidant [ 45], inhibits lipid peroxidation, and does not induce genotoxicity [ 46].
